metadata.synopsis: Though she's a talented gymnast, Janey (Sarah Jessica Parker) has always followed the orders of her strict Army colonel father and stayed out of the spotlight. However, when she moves to a new town and meets the carefree Lynne (Helen Hunt), she disobeys her father for the first time in her life. With Lynne's encouragement, Janey enters a TV dance competition -- and soon finds herself with both a cute dance partner and an archrival who is dead set on getting Janey eliminated from the contest.

reviews: Dance to the cheesy '80s beat with tweens and up.
We all know a movie like this isn't appealing to anyone beside the folks who grew up during that time. And even they will be compelled to cringe at its mention...
It's a total wannabe in the realm of 80s teen flicks.
Nostalgia forces me to like this. Yes I feel guilty!
Sarah Jessica Parker's embarrassing contribution to that much-studied genre known as the "'80s teen movie"
Metter's "Girls" may just want to have fun but for the rest of us this concept is just wishful thinking.
If you're going to base a movie on a song, why not choose a song that's, y'know, about something?
